What is quiet firing: A new workplace trend or a serious phenomenon?
description: Quiet firing describes a subtle but damaging workplace practice where employees are slowly pushed out through silence, exclusion, and shrinking responsibilities rather than formal termination. Often mistaken for a passing trend, it reflects deeper leadership failures and risk avoidance. The practice thrives in disengaged, remote workplaces, carrying serious psychological costs for employees and long-term consequences for organisations.

title: AI debate: Mathematician Joel Hamkins warns; ‘LLMs give wrong answers’
description: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet turned into the 49ers’ $8.4B empire
description: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.
